tools.name: FLUX_1_Kontext_Dev_infer
tools.description: Perform image editing using the FLUX.1 Kontext pipeline. This function takes an input image and a text prompt to generate a modified version of the image based on the provided instructions. It uses the FLUX.1 Kontext model for contextual image editing tasks. If a user passes a file as an input, use the upload_file_to_gradio tool, if present, to upload the file to the gradio app and create a Gradio File Input. Then use the returned path as the input to the tool. Returns: A 3-tuple containing:, PIL.Image.Image: The generated/edited image, int: The seed value used for generation (useful when randomize_seed=True), gr.update: Gradio update object to make the reuse button visible, , >>> edited_image, used_seed, button_update = infer(, ...     input_image=my_image,, ...     prompt="Add sunglasses",, ...     seed=123,, ...     randomize_seed=False,, ...     guidance_scale=2.5, ... )

input_image.title: ImageData
input_image.description: The input image to be edited. Will be converted
input_image.format: Gradio File Input - a http or https url to a file

prompt.description: Text description of the desired edit to apply to the image.

seed.description: Random seed for reproducible generation. Defaults to 42.

randomize_seed.description: If True, generates a random seed instead of

guidance_scale.description: Controls how closely the model follows the

steps.description: Controls how many steps to run the diffusion model for.
